Acquire a File-Based Lock for a User's Account File

Source: R/helpers.R
with_lock_file.Rd

Provides exclusive access to a user's account file using a file-based lock. A temporary lock file is created in the user's directory to signal that the account file is in use. Other processes wait until this lock file is removed or a timeout is reached.

Usage

with_lock_file(
  user_id,
  expr,
  base_dir,
  file_name = "account_tree.Rds",
  timeout = 1800
)

Arguments

user_id

The user ID whose account file should be locked.

expr

An expression to evaluate once the lock has been acquired.

base_dir

Base directory where user files are stored.

file_name

Name of the account file to lock (default: "account_tree.Rds"). The lock file is automatically derived by replacing the extension with .lock, e.g., "account_tree.lock".

timeout

Maximum time in seconds to wait for the lock before failing. Default is 1800 seconds (30 minutes).

Value

The result of evaluating expr once the lock is acquired.

Details

The lock is implemented by creating a file with the same base name as file_name, but with a .lock extension. If the lock file already exists, the function waits until it is removed. The process ID of the locking process is written to the lock file for debugging purposes.

When the expression finishes (normally or due to an error), the lock file is automatically removed via on.exit(), ensuring the lock is released.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Run a critical section safely under a file lock
result <- with_lock_file("user123", {
  account <- load_user_file("user123", "account_tree.Rds")
  account$balance <- account$balance + 50
  save_user_file("user123", account, "account_tree.Rds")
  account$balance
}, base_dir = "/data/accounts")
} # }
